org: Knight Foundation School of Computing & Information Sciences, FIU
summary: Online, near-peer tutoring across IT fundamentals with a focus on clear explanations, research-backed answers, and strong documentation.
highlights: Help students across networking, systems, databases, and programming; translate technical topics for non-technical learners.
Research mini-briefs on current topics (AI safety, detection engineering basics, IAM pitfalls, NLP fundamentals) under STARS organization.
Document concise study guides, lab walkthroughs, and diagrams (Word/PowerPoint/Visio); maintain auditable activity logs for each session.
Support proctored assessments (ID checks, integrity, escalation) and handle student data confidentially.
Surface patterns from tutoring notes (common misconfigs, permission errors) to instructors to improve course materials.

summary: Kept lab software/hardware reliable and ready; built hands-on environments and supported CTF practice.
highlights: Prepared and maintained 30+ Linux/Windows lab machines: imaging, patching, driver/software installs, and smoke-tests.
Built a reusable VirtualBox VM (Kali/Ubuntu) preloaded with a CTF toolchain (Nmap, Wireshark, Burp, Metasploit); managed snapshots and NAT/bridged networking.
Stood up/verified lab services and configs (SSH, web server examples, firewalls, subnet/VLAN basics) for classroom exercises.
Authored quick-start sheets and troubleshooting checklists that cut recurring script/config errors ~50%.
Supported CTF prep sessions: environment setup, basic exploitation labs, and safe-practice guidelines.
